title: Anyone Interested?
content:
Is anyone interested in a 2player game where Keen and Mort fight? It uses the original keen engine so u can do all that stuff, including poles, ledge grabbing, pogo, (no moving or drop down platforms yet). I got it working last night after like 6 hours of program time from scratch. (yay!) And I can't find any bugs (YAY!)
I can take suggestions. RIght now its gonna be you just set the amount of hits to win, start amount of ammo, the recharge time and recharge amount (such as 2 per 5 seconds, or x per y seconds), the level, and the music (original keen music).
It's not online, sorry. I wish I knew how to do that.- .... . <> ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . <> .. ... <> - --- .- ... -

title: Re: Anyone Interested?
content:
it is being made with game maker, and the engine almost has the same features as the original:
jump, pogo, ledge-grab, poles, look down/up (no view scroll), and fireing at any time and position except on pogo stick and during ledge grab.
There are currently three major differences:
(1) When you move downwards on a pole, the sprite of Keen is not of him swinging around it; it is the same as the upward pole movement on whatever side he's on. This was easier and made more sense to me, cuz if u shoot up/down on a pole, the blast will be on either the left side or right side, so seeing which side you;re on when moving down is important.
(2). There are no moving platforms or ledges that you can drop down from by pressing DOWN + CTRL
(you can now pogo high from the ground, which is the only way to do the impossible pogo trick)
(3). The jump and pogo heights are probably a little different.
(4). The run and pole climb/descend speeds are probably a bit different.
(5). You always accelerate in free fall. I may change this.

The only bug i have found is the following:
When hitting a corner of the block exactly the right way you will instantly appear either at the top of the next block above or the bottom, depending on if you're moving up or down. This used to be instantly appearing at block highest up from where you were or fartherst down.
I rather liked that bug however; it adds interesting gameplay and I called it the impossible grappling hook trick.- .... . <> ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . <> .. ... <> - --- .- ... -

Thanks to ImageShack for [url=http://imageshack.us]Free Image Hosting[/url]

The engine is up and running with no known debilitating bugs. However, I am going to remove the impossible grapping hook trick, if I can, since it is semi-debilitating.

Features: jump, pogo, pogo high, impossible pogo trick, pole climbing, duck, ledge grab and pull up, firing from most positions and in all 4 directions, including mid-air, on-pole, up from ground, etc...

Not featured: internet play, platforms you can drop down from, poles that go inside a platform, moving platforms, AI enemies, hazards, (basically anything that manipulates the environment like swithces).

Not Featured yet but planned to implement: modes of play like accuracy way, time-limit, etc., music, possibly hazards, possibly enemies, possibly other weapons, impossible bullet trick.- .... . <> ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . <> .. ... <> - --- .- ... -

I'm still trying to get rid of the impossible grappling hook trick; plus another thing, not really a bug, just the settings, but it's tricky.

I could use original Keen floor and wall tiles if you want. What do u think? Are my custom ones better? They come in 8 colors, Red, yellow, green, teal, blue, purple, gray, and brown. The poles come in the same colors [EDIT: except brown] and I try to contrast them with the chosen floor color.
BTW no secret passages, but it'd be real easy.

Right now, I'm thinking there should be types of arenas to battle in:

Ring: no hazards, enemies, platforms, or bridges
Arena: moving plats and bridges
Battle Ground: previous elements plus hazards
Stadium: previous elements plus enemies

Plus there could be types of battles:

certain # of lives
time limit where person who shoots opponent the most wins
accuracy war where person who is the most accurate wins
any other types of battles or types of levels you all can thnk of?

title: UPDATES AND SCHEDULE
content:
[GRAPHICS]
DONE:
---Tiles now come in 9 colors, red, yellow, green, teal, blue, purple, orange, brown, pink, white, gray, black. Pole tiles come in 10, the first six in the previous list plus gray, plus brown. plus the graish rope stuff in Keen 5, and the vines in Keen 6.
---An automatic tiling script so I don't have to waste time painting my levels. This has now been updated to 40x40 (previously 80x80) and that was no cakewalk. Blocks also come in 40x40 so that is the new grid snap for more flexablility [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img]
---made tiles 2x and more detailed.
---tile colors can be swapped; such as pink on blue. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img]

DO:
---add original tiles and sprites for points, hazards, enemies, all other original stuff
---get autotiler working for all ramps and original sets


[SOUNDS]
DONE:
---jump, one fire sound, fire hit, pogo, fall, land on ground, helmet hit, die, empty gun click/switch change, point grab sound, droplet/vitalin/viva grab, 1 up sound, gem grab,
---three original enter level tunes and three original exit level tunes

DO:
---add run sound, more fire sounds, door open/close, enemy and hazard sounds,

[MUSIC]
DONE:
---nothing, lol, yet...

DO:
---add all original keen songs somehow

[ENGINE]
DONE:
---player run, jump, pogo, ledge grab and pull up/drop down, poles, shoot from ground/air/poles, look up/down with view SCROLL, Impossible Pogo trick
---all ramps!, drop-down plats!!, moving plats!!!, poles through ground!!!! IBT!!!!
---LOOK DOWN MANEUVER CHANGED; YOU FACE EITHER WAY WHEN CROUCHING AND YOU CAN FIRE A LOW SHOT; YOU ALSO ARE LOW ENOUGH TO DODGE NORMAL SHOT; WOOT!
---made drop down ramps of both steeps!!!!
---pogo crush at high speed!
---blocks now are as small as 40x40 (auto tiling script is functioning for basic blocks, poles, ddps! WOOT!)
---switches with bridges and lasers (no plat path change yet, and no tilies worked with them yet)

DO:
---Primary: 2ssp? switch/door/place gem handling with sprite,
---Secondary: switches with plat path change (and tiling of all switch maneuvers), bridges, doors, gem doors, items, One-ups?, hazards, enemies, other weapons????????

[GAMEPLAY]
DONE:
---able to set beginning number of lives, beginning ammo, ammo recharge amount and ammo recharge time (x shots every y seconds)
---able to select one of 8 (not original) levels
---Mort's controls use the FGHT keys as a replacement for the arrow keys, and A as the ALT replacement and the D as the CTRL replacement. (It's a little counter-intuitive because in every other instance, Keen and his data are on the left, and Mort on the right.)
---Two button firing only, but you won't accidently jump or pogo once you get good. It's not hard.
---I'm considering adding extra characters now....

DO:
---modes of play: Hits to Win, Most Hits under Time Limit, Accuracy War, Most Points Collected, Race
---able to turn on/off hazards, enemies, gems/doors, bridges, moving platforms, points, etc
---add all levels from all 7 Keens and make other levels
---maybe extra characters...

[SPECIAL]

DO:
---organizedmenu
---custom level editor... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img]
---BWBvsTQD
---no other weapons exactly, but cheats with them hehe
---considering internet play...cuz that would be the bomb-diggity [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img]
---make a tuturial of everything

[GUESS WHAT]
---There is 1 bug so far. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img] Im on a roll;
---If anyone can suggest any other weapons that are worth implementing, I will; keep in mind this game is not about mass destruction but about tactical platform warfare between the two smartest beings in the Universe.
---Any other suggestions welcome.



Imagine standing in front of a switch so your opponent can't see it, then he jumps through an off laser beam (those things in K6), and you activate it right as he passes through, defeating him; or imagine running a good few blocks ahead of your opponent, coming up to robo red, shooting it, and then pogoing over it while your opponent is too far behind to do the same (but maybe he shoots the incoming Robo Red blasts to cancel them out.) All this will be possible.


FreeYorp101: sorry for missing that question for so long; the settings you can set do save for the next battle

ZeroDiamond: that background is now tiling correctly.

CommanderSpleen, trust me, Game Maker pwnz. You shall see.

Mort whats your GMC name?

title: Reef
content:
I must admit it's been a long time since I tried GM, so it's obviously become more capable than it once was. I won't compare it with TGF or MMF, as I don't use those any more, but my main gripes are with bloat, limited operating system support (ie. Windows only), and excessive resource requirements (simple platformers should be able to run on an old Pentium, at the most extreme).

Some of these issues may be unfounded, but it's just the general impression I get. It doesn't bother me that much, though. If the result is good I'm all for it. I just prefer to play and create games that are more flexible, cross-platform and compact.

title: Re: Reef
content:
Taken straight from the Game Maker help file:

"Game Maker requires a modern Pentium PC [EDIT: I highly doubt you that Athalon or another processor doesnt' work] running Windows 98SE, 2000, Me, XP, or later. A DirectX 8 compatible graphics card with at least 16MB of memory is required for most created games. It requires a screen resolution of at least 800x600 and 65000 (16-bit) colors. Also a DirectX 8 compatible sound card is required. It requires DirectX version 8.0 or later to be installed on your computer. (You can download the newest version of DirectX from the Microsoft website at: [url=http://www.microsoft.com/windows/directx/.)]www.microsoft.com/windows/directx/.)[/url] When designing and testing games, the memory requirements are pretty high (at least 64 MB and preferably more, also depending on the operating system). When just running games, the memory requirements are less severe and depend a lot on the type of game. "

All of that is not bad for these days, but point taken about only running on windows. Still, GM pwns; maybe one day I won't believe it anymore since I don't know any other real language, but I know I've mastered GML (minus internet and particles) and I know what I can do with it and it's alot. [EDIT: O and how could I 4get; ITS FREE ($20 registered, which is useful, but you can do quite alot without it).
The resources are excessive because GM is designed to be able to make any kind of game, and thus has to be broad. If you wanted to make one specific kind of game, then you could write the engine to be the least resource-requiring, get what i mean.

Alex, I got no clue what you mean by GMC; I'm not on any Game Maker forums unless I forgot lol. Oh and there's plenty games made in GM worth playing
[url=http://www.gamemakergames.com/]www.gamemakergames.com/[/url]
I highly recommend games by PugFugly; stupid name, but he pwnz; his games are very arcade style of the old days

GM can do 3d u know, and I know how to do that too. I try to think of cool, original 3d style games for Keen. I believe that TUIT should be a new way of 3d games, just like KEEN1 had the new side-scrollling trick never before seen.TUIT should have a unique, orignal engine too. Not that I'm qualified to make it or anything lol.- .... . <> ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . <> .. ... <> - --- .- ... -

title: Beta Test
content:
Not quite ready yet; I just wanna finish my auto-tile function;
But if you wanna test, then here is what I ask of you:

Do not give the program to anyone else whatsoever;
Do not steal my work;
Do not moddify the program;
Delete it after a while, like after you're done testing it or another beta comes out;
Of course, do your best to find bugs and comment on anything you want; I would appreciate a report sent straight to me, and you could comment on the game's good-ness on the forums;

All I want tested is the movement engine, so expect something like a big level feauring all current elements; Keen and Mort must be exactly the same, so test for any differences in them too;

I just need some time to finish the auto-tile for ramps; it's not easy;

In the meantime, here's a conceptual question for you computer geniuses:
I have two options for tiling things--either have huge sets of all tiles in all colors, or make one set for each picture in black and white and use color blending. Now, which one would use less memory/processing power? Don't worry about file size, cuz i'm sure the former option takes more HD space.
- .... . / ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . / .. ... / - --- .- ... - / .-.

title: Re: Beta Test
content:
I say use the colour blending option, simply because it's a lot less work. Having to draw up a new set of tiles for every colour, even if you have an automated means of achieving it, is not worth the effort unless it's the only way about it (like when you're modding Keen 1-3).

And for what it's worth, I do like the swirly tiles. However, they could do with some checkerboarding (or proper shading if you plan to increase the colour depth), and more gradual angles. Maybe even an extra tile leaning in the other direction for the sake of variety.

Is there any particular reason you chose 19x19 as the tile size? Quite an unusual figure.

title: Re: Beta Test
content:
lol the squares for blocks are 20x20 at 2x for 40x40; getting the tiles to match means double-trouble: for the 2d squares and the iso's on top. I can say, however, that all iso tiles are multiples of 5, and at 2x, makes the end result all multiples of 10.
The bigger ramps tiles (2d part) are 80x60 for shallow and 40x60 for steep (remember, 2x them).
But Spleen, don't worry about effort; all i'm concerned about is processing power; which is faster for the comp to calculate and draw.- .... . / ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . / .. ... / - --- .- ... - / .-.

title: Re: Beta Test
content:
[hr]MiB the squares for blocks are 20x20 at 2x for 40x40;
[hr]Ah. I guess I must have clipped them wrong when I was messing around in Paint.

[hr]MiB all i'm concerned about is processing power
[hr]Good to hear someone still cares about efficiency these days. It seems logical that colour blending would require more power, but just how much more would probably require some experimentation. Maybe someone more familiar with how Game Maker does those things might be of more help.

That said, there are two other factors you'd do well to consider:
1) RAM - if the tileset becomes a lot larger, you're going to be using up more memory. You'll need to keep that balance in mind.
2) Flexibility - if you make versatiles [pun blatantly intentional] you have a lot more freedom in theming your levels.

I say try both and find a way of benchmarking the outcomes.

title: Re: Beta Test
content:
[EDIT:] Oh darn, the larger the tileset, the more ram is needed to take it in lol; i knew that. blending would be quicker then, i think. and spleen whatdaumean by benchmarking?

lol i have to care about processing power; you know how many collision checks are needed in this platform game?
But actually, i was concerned about internet play...im not promising it, but i gotta try and keep things optimized; maybe processing doesnt matter as long as it's not like 99% cpu, cuz internet lag is indepentent of that.
btw, I already made tile sets using every color; it wasn't that bad, just copy, paste and change this color into that and viola; but then i have to write scripts that call the right color; for example:

tile_add(NewTilesFront, a, b, 20, 20, x-20+10, y+20, -1)

a and b are the beginning coordinates of the tile slice and 20, 20, is the length and height to use.

tile_add(NewTilesFront, 0+(0*80), 0+(0*80), 20, 20, x-20+10, y+20, -1)

0+(0*80) can be though of as sets; the 0+ is the location of the tile in the set of red colors (or whatever color) and the (0*80) is whatever color you want, cuz each set all one color tiles next to each other is 80 pxls. so (1*80) switches to the next set on the right, which would be yellow; or if that's in the height part, it siwtches to the next set beneath.
- .... . / ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . / .. ... / - --- .- ... - / .-.

title: Benchmarks
content:
There's little difference in most resources. Taken straight from windows task manager


Blending: Page File use 300MB; Mem Use 41,932K
No Blending: Page File use 321MB; Mem Use 19,752K {EDIT: MORE LIKE 50,000K!!!!!!!} dumb me
BOTH: about 45 - 50% of my 3GHz processor

As you can see, no blending uses 25% MORE RAM!!!!, blending is still under 64MB. Page File use in no blending is als0 worse, but only 7% more.
I thought blending was the better choice anyway.
For those of you who don't know, page file is ram that is written to the hard drive, which is slower.


Okay, so Davince, what's the word? it's been like 3 days now. At least tell us what you think of it.
- .... . / ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . / .. ... / - --- .- ... - / .-.

title: Re: Benchmarks
content: no, cuz the game maker editor was also running, since i ran the game from it. The operating system uses lots of ram too, of course. The Page File usage data was for everything running, not just the game. Task Manager just works that way.- .... . / ..-  -. .. ...- . .-. ... . / .. ... / - --- .- ... - / .-.

title: Re: Benchmarks
content:
Why don't you go into the Task Manager options and enable the VM size columns, that will give you the page file use per-application, instead of for your overall system, which will be much more accurate.

You'll find that the overall page file size increases the longer you've been running Windows (after a couple of weeks it's not uncommon to be well over 1GB with no programs running) so it's an extremely inaccurate way of measuring resources, unless you restart your PC between each test.

title: Re: Benchmarks
content:
In options, there are only three things: always on top, minimize on use, and hide when minimized, so idk what VM columns are, unless you're referring to the "processes" tab that has Image Name, User Name, CPU and mem usage (which is where I got mem usage from on my post). Im on Windows XP.
edit: btw, i did restart before each test- .... . / ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . / .. ... / - --- .- ... - / .-.

title: Re: Benchmarks
content:
lol, not "in the options menu" I meant the options generally. There's a menu item somewhere called "columns" or something that lets you choose which columns you want displayed, and there's about 30 things you can tick or untick, and this affects what columns show up on the "processes" tab (e.g. you can turn off the User Name column.) Maybe you have to be on the processes tab before you can see the menu item.

Just look through the menus until you find it. I can't remember what it's called and I can't check as I don't run Windows here.

title: Progress and Update
content:
Oh, well, I haven't worked on this in a long time. I've got lasers, moving plat paths, and bridges working for switches. (not including correct tiling with bridges). And I got doors to work (again, not tiling), both key card from K1-3 and gem type.
Um, I hate to say this to you all, but I'm really considering not releasing this to the public at large. It has to do with my outlook on art (not the fact that it's too much work); ugh I can'[t even remember. I just felt I better say this sooner rather than later.
Man I can't even remember right now why I don't wanna release my stuff. Something to do with too much entertainment--something...oh and something about protecting my work from stealers (ironic since I "stole" from Keen). Anyway, the point is I may not give this out to everyone. I'll edit this post when I can remember and write my reasons.
Thank you tho, LoG, for your offer. Even if I do release it, I should say I proly won't need any help in art since it's gonna use mostly original stuff. But I'm still curious to what kind of art you can do. What do you specialize in? (I've seen your K3 tile and art remake stuff, but that's all i think).
- .... . / ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . / .. ... / - --- .- ... - / .-.

title: Proliferated and Undead
content:
Aye, there's very little point in making a game if you're not going to let people play it. Sounds like you've bought into the entertainment industries' paranoia, which says that everyone is a thief that just wants to rip you off. The situation isn't nearly that desperate.

Besides, if someone does use your work, it'll most likely be either for their own education or to improve the work, both of which are good outcomes. And generally they'll cite your project in some kind of Acknowledgements list.

Just add a little licence or disclaimer asking the end user not to use this work for their own purposes without affording you credit, or without asking you first. You'd be surprised to find people are generally happy to accept such terms.

It's not like you'll be making money off this anyway, and if you make a simple site or something about the game you'll have a degree of proof that you created it first in the unlikely event someone tries to pawn it off as their own. Take care to put your name, email and website in the readme and a couple of places in the game.

I hope that doesn't sound arrogant, about me worrying that my thing will be too popular, for goodness sakes. But I think I really have something here; and the more popular, the more likely it will get stoeln. I am paraoind!

- .... . / ..- -. .. ...- . .-. ... . / .. ... / - --- .- ... - / .-.

title: Re: Proliferated and Undead
content:
So what would happen if your work was "stolen"? If you released it to the Keen community everyone would know it was originally your work, and the thief wouldn't get any credit.

I think the potential benefit (making people happy by providing them with something entertaining) far outweighs any potential negatives. As a programmer brought up on DOS/Windows, I used to think this way - I was paranoid that if I released my programs people would try to steal them, but once I moved over to the Linux world where *everyone* releases their programs, source code and all, completely for free, suddenly I realised that I was worrying over nothing.

Once you can let go of the paranoia, after your first couple of full releases you'll wonder what you used to worry about [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Proliferated and Undead
content:
"My dear friend, worrying about all the suffering in the world isn't going to do a damn bit of good," -LoG

Um, not really. There's lots you can do. There are plenty of people who give this no real thought and do nothing about it. That won't be me. I will give money to orgs for this and serve in them.
